title: nt.number theory - prime decomposition in even dihedral extensions
body: Let $L/K$ be a finite extension of number fields of degree $n$ with $n$ an even integer such that the normal closure of $L$ has the Galois group isomorphic to $D_n$ , the dihedral group of order $2n$ . Is there any result about the decomposition form of a prime $\mathfrak{p}$ of $K$ in $L$ ? nt.number-theory analytic-number-theory algebraic-number-theory number-fields Share Cite Improve this question Follow asked Jun 15, 2020 at 15:26 A. Maarefparvar 597 2 2 silver badges 9 9 bronze badges $\endgroup$ 2 $\begingroup$ Can you be a little more specific as to what you're looking for? Do you understand the general situation for relating splitting in $L/K$ to splitting in the Galois closure? If not, I'd say this is more appropriate for MathStackExchange. $\endgroup$ Kimball –  Kimball 2020-06-15 16:15:03 +00:00 Commented Jun 15, 2020 at 16:15 $\begingroup$ Many thanks for your response. I'm looking for an explicit decomposition form in "even dihedral extensions L/K" (or in the Galois closure of L over K) as in Cohen's book (Advanced Topics in Computational Number Theory, Proposition 10.1.26) the decomposition form of primes in a "prime order" dihedral extensions is formulated. $\endgroup$ A.
